elements.title: Serekunda (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that because the capital of The Gambia is on a small island, its population has overflowed into Serekunda (pictured) in the nearby municipality of Kanifing?

elements.title: Nancy S. Steinhardt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nancy S. Steinhardt completed her doctorate on medieval Chinese architecture before she was able to see any in person?

elements.title: Archcliffe Fort (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that much of Archcliffe Fort was demolished in the 1920s to allow for expansion of a railway?

elements.title: Alfred Sully (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alfred Sully, who led US forces during the Sioux Wars, was married to a Yankton Sioux woman?

elements.title: The Right and the Wrong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Right and the Wrong was the first feature film produced natively in Trinidad and Tobago?

elements.title: Don Goodwin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 23-day CBC strike thrust Don Goodwin into the Canadian national spotlight and into "folk-hero status"?

elements.title: an Olivia Rodrigo song (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the lyric video for an Olivia Rodrigo song included a teaser that she would tour in support of her album Guts?

elements.title: Cosmere Roleplaying Game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Cosmere Roleplaying Game surpassed Frosthaven to become the most-funded tabletop game on Kickstarter in August 2024?

elements.title: Honest Ike (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Honest Ike" stole more than $200,000 from the Alabama treasury?
